fields.description:
In the same confluence install:
1) add a space with Easy Reader Theme
2) add a space with Documentation Theme
3) add a link in the Easy Reader space to the documentation space
4) follow the link

Result: the Navigation bar is collapsed
Expected result: the navigation bar should be visible as if you were accessing the space immediately.
fields.summary: Switching from a space with easy reader theme to a space with documentation theme collapse the navigation bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25790].
  {panel}

It seems that JIRA users who do not have permission to access Confluence can still see the status updates of Confluence users.  

Steps to replicate (per-requisite: Set up JIRA and Confluence application link):
# Set up Confluence to use JIRA user base
# Create a user that does not have access to Confluence.  In other words, users can only access JIRA.  For example JIRAuser
# A user in Confluence [updates his/her status|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF34/Viewing+Status+Updates]
# Login to JIRA as a user who does not have permission to Confluence.  This user is still able to see the status updates of Confluence Users from JIRA Activity Stream.
fields.summary: Users who do not have permission to access Confluence are able to see Confluence's status update on JIRA Activity Stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25785].
  {panel}

While most of the time users will use the Charts Macro without wiki markup, there are certainly cases where wiki markup is necessary. For example, wrapping with the {run} macro. 

The older pages of the documentation helpfully describe the parameters: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=256869846

But this is no longer visible on the current page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Chart+Macro

This is really key information to present, please include in the existing documentation going forward.
fields.summary: Document wiki markup for Charts Macro
Allow templates to be created in the new confluence editor
worddav/adminword.action leaks confluence home directory information to non-sysadmin users (to administrators).

fields.description:
h3.Problem

By Default, means that it should not be configured to change the expected behavior.

However this trigger acts as a ENABLE/DISABLE function. If its not marked as default it does not send any notification. Even if the user has requested to receive a summary of all actions taken during the week/day.

h3.Another point of interest

This option also ignores the user preferences. If the user has REQUESTED to receive notifications it will not send if this is disabled. If the user has NOT REQUESTED to receive such notifications it will send anyway if the Default option is enabled.

h3.Implying
{color:red}Does not work if Default is disabled{color}
fields.summary: Recommended Updates are ignored if "Default" option is disabled. No Recommended Updates are send if Default is disabled.
Confluence upgrade process should not chown/chmod hidden folders

fields.description:
In this bug, Lucene is playing a big role in this scenario, as you can see from the screenshots attached.

h2.Steps to reproduce:

# Set the Indexation Language as French
# Create new pages including any word (e.g. "potato") in all versions, including lowercase and uppercase
# Then perform searches also using lower and uppercase located randomly in the word.

h2.Workaround:
There's no workaround in this moment.
fields.summary: Quick Seach with mix case in French, causes a different behavior.

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the following in your Confluence [system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties]:
{code}
-Duser.language=tr -Duser.region=TR
{code} 
# Restart Confluence
# Try any of the following scenarios: 
## Scenario #1 - Space Permission:
(i) There could be some other variety of scenarios on how strange it could be. The following is just one of it:
Give the highlighted permission to any of your group:
!bonfire-screenshot-20120619-223848-416.png!
Save it, changes are not applied correctly:
!bonfire-screenshot-20120619-223949-275.png!
## Scenario #2 - Global Permission:
Give the highlighted permission to any of your group:
!bonfire-screenshot-20120619-224403-228.png!
Save it, changes are not applied correctly:
!bonfire-screenshot-20120619-224516-091.png!

h4. Workaround
Add the following flag to your Confluence [system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties] and restart Confluence:
{code}
-Duser.language=en -Duser.region=US
{code} 

h4. Possible Cause
http://mattryall.net/blog/2009/02/the-infamous-turkish-locale-bug
fields.summary: Turkish Locale is causing Global and Space Permission grants/revokes behaving very strange

fields.description:
This page on CAC is frequently receiving duplicate comments -

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback

Basically, the page is now so slow that when you post a comment it takes too long and the UI gives a timeout error message. People then try again resulting in a duplicate comment.

There are a few things we should consider here -
1) Increase the timeout setting for comment posting (for a quick reduction in the impact).
2) Investigate why commenting on a page with a large number of comments is so slow. Is this a general product problem (probably) or a CAC specific environment issue?
3) Can we generally protect against duplicate comments (e.g. hash checking or something along those lines)?
fields.summary: Posting comments on a page with hundreds of comments is giving frequent time outs and leading to many duplicate comments

fields.description:
Using the copy/source feature of the code macro, where one is able to copy the content of the code block, doesn't work as expected in Chrome. Space characters (32) are displayed as, and therefore copied as, (160) - a non-breaking space.

This appears to be due to the use of {noformat} {noformat} when rendering spaces in the code blocks. Chrome now faithfully renders {noformat} {noformat} using the correct unicode character 160.

This can cause interesting problems when trying to copy a code block to a terminal or other application.
fields.summary: Copy/source mode in code macro using incorrect character for a space in Chrome

fields.description:
When editing in a table I have the following (in wiki markup) {code} ||Heading||Heading|| |Item | * list item 1 * list item 2 * list item 3 | {code} which renders like ||Heading||Heading|| |Item | * list item 1 * list item 2 * list item 3 | If I then go to list item 1, delete the text "list item 1" and then backspace to remove the bullet, I am left with a hard line break above the bulleted list that I cannot remove *at all* in the new editor. source code from source editor: {code}

Heading

Heading

Item
  • list item 2
  • list item 3
{code} To remove the hard < br > character I have to use the source editor. You need to either not put in a hard < br > or make it so that backspace / delete can remove it.

Backspace to delete a bullet in a table cell leaves a
that cannot be removed

fields.description:
* Tried to copy a page from an internal Atlassian instance.
* Received error message (attached).  
* Hit save again, same error.
* Cancelled
* Tried again (copy page)
* Worked successfully.

The page contains a page template, so that might be the issue?

I might have changed the location of the page the first time, but can't be 100% sure.  Otherwise this seems intermittent, and a royal pain to reproduce.
fields.summary: Copying a page on EAC: Failure when converting to storage format

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

    In Chrome 19, IE 8 or IE 9, edit a Confluence page.
    Try to create a link with the following URL:

    https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+the+Planning+Board#UsingthePlanningBoard-PlanningBoard—NavigationBar

    Save the page.

The link should not be clickable, and an inspection of the generated HTML should show an <a> with no href attribute.

The same procedure under Firefox 12 creates a usable link.
fields.summary: Inserting a weblink result in an unclickable link

fields.description:
When using the html macro on a page with other wiki macros, preview will show the content of the page rendering correctly. When saving the page, if the html macro content contains {noformat}

<html><head></head><body>
{noformat}

tags, then the above behavior is observed. If those tags are removed, then the wiki macros/content and the html macro content are rendered properly. 

Confluence should display/render both the preview and the saved copy of the page the same, which is not the case.


Support ticket reference case:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-83123
fields.summary: HTML macro does not display wiki content properly when html tags used
Like Gadget breaks unless used within the Page Include macro

fields.description:
When attempting to add watchers to articles, auto-complete is working as expected, but users are given an error message that reads "Failed to add watcher: error" (see screenshot attached).  

Despite the error, the watcher is actually successfully added.  

Once the error is acknowledged, the main watcher screen continues to say "Adding watcher" while the "waiting" icon spins indefinitely.  Attempting to add the same user again results in the expected "user already watching" error.

This appears to happen 100% of the time, across all user accounts and spaces (for example, I'm a global admin and it happens to me.)  Nothing appears in the logs for this.

Historically, this also showed up for us in Confluence 4.1.x.
fields.summary: Adding watchers results in "Failed to add watcher: error" message, but watcher is added successfully

fields.description:
The DetailSummary macro has stopped working on our hosted confluence site site the last system upgrade.

We get the following error:
Error rendering macro 'detailssummary' : [Ljava.lang.Object; cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.labels.Labelling

I thought this might be a support issue, but when I checked on Atlassian's documentation page for the macro, it shows the same error, so it appears you are having the same problem we are. See here: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Detailssummary+Macro

If this is just us doing something wrong I apologise for posting here.

Stu French

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

Create 2 spaces A and B.
In space A, create a page hierarchy like this:
* Parent Page
** Child Page 1
** Child Page 2
** Child Page 3

In space A, go to Browse > Pages and click on "Tree" and then use drag and drop to reorder the pages like this:
* Parent Page
** Child Page 3
** Child Page 2
** Child Page 1

Go to "Parent Page" in space A and move it to space B, ensuring that the "Reorder" checkbox is _not_ selected.

Go to Browse > Pages in space B. The ordering will be lost, and instead pages will be sorted alphabetically like this:
* Parent Page
** Child Page 1
** Child Page 2
** Child Page 3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25726].
  {panel}

*Summary of the Request*

When third party plugin installed in Confluence, administrator don't have the power to configure which plugins are listed when Confluence user click on the "Insert" button.

This resulted to a long ugly list of third party plugins filled up the window and since there are no scroll bar, users won't be able to choose "Other Macros" button.

*Propose Improvement*

It would be great if Confluence administrator have the ability to chose which plugins Confluence editor listed on the main menu of the "Insert" button. By adding an extra option of "Listed" on the plugin option in "Universal Plugin Manager", Confluence administrator will have the ability to ensure which plugin listed and which are not
fields.summary: Ability to configure which plugins listed in the "Insert" button

When you go to the attachment list via the menu, it displays correctly.
I have added two screenshots to illustrate this.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25723].
  {panel}

While Remote issue and Confluence Linking is a key feature in Jira 5, it would be great to get somewhat for confluence too to improve prominent documentation and issue links within a confluence page


From https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-80933
{quote}Is there some native way for getting a list of incoming links and referrers (incoming links from Jira 5) as a page element.
Currently these informations are just "metadata" in the page info which must be navigated and can't be exported as PDF etc.

Adaptavist seems to have some (partial) solutions but as far as I can see not covering the new Jira "Trackback pings".
https://www.adaptavist.com/display/AtlassianConfluence/incoming-links+macro

~Marcel
{quote}

{quote}
HengHwa Loi [Atlassian] added a comment - 07/May/12 5:24 AM
Hi Marcel,

To answer your original question:

I'm afraid no, there're no such feature in Confluence yet, the referrers is hard coded into the metadata page and I don't think there's a place to take that part out.
{quote}
fields.summary: Macro for displaying referrers / incoming links needed

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25707].
  {panel}

As per our support request CSP-82926 :

We would like to filter RSS news items produced by Confluence feed builder, using the following parameters :

* Start date and end date (instead of using the timeSpan parameter, which only lists the last X days, we would like to use specific dates, this is useful to extracting news items to compose meeting reports for instance)

* Filter authors according to the User Groups they belong to : so instead of for instance having authors=jblogg,jdoe we could refer to groups author-groups=myfirstgroup,mysecondgroup
fields.summary: RSS Feed builder should support filtering authors by groups and use START and END dates

fields.description:
It is not possible to execute complex search queries using the Confluence REST API. Any usages of reserved characters in the query are escaped and treated literally.

For example, the search query {{title:test}} gets escaped to {{title\\\:test}} before being executed. You can see this escaping happening in {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.rest.search.RestSearchParameters}}.

This was done to allow the Link browser to search for content that contains special characters in the title, however I think the implementation is wrong. The link browser should escape its own search query before sending it to the search service. The search service should not assume that any special lucene characters are not intended to be used for their actual purpose.
fields.summary: Advanced search queries cannot be performed against the Confluence REST API
Upgrade TOC to 2.5.12 or higher for OnDemand instances to fix TOC-64

fields.description:
From advanced macros at least the following macros are affected -
* content-by-user
* index
* junitreport

I think what is going on here is that these macros are of the "ancient" Radeox variety. This means they don't specify whether they have a body or not.

Consequently, if you were to automatically migrate content using these macros during the wiki to XHTML upgrade you could end up discarding page content.
e.g. Take the wiki source -
{noformat}
some text
{content-by-user}
Not body text for the content-by-user macro. Just some text before a second independent instance of the macro.
{content-by-user}
finished
{noformat}
The text between the two 'content-by-user' macro instances would be taken as the body of the macro. And since it doesn't actually store a body this text would be lost.

So to avoid this problem this macro and the others mentioned were not added to the whitelist in wikiToXhtmlMigrationContext.xml (see the macroMigrationManager bean).

However, it is simply an implementation quirk that the usage of these macros in the editor via the wiki markup dialog or autoformatting is broken.
fields.summary: autoformat and 'insert wiki markup' dialog will not convert certain macros such as content-by-user

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

As Described on this bug report:

* [CONF-24055|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24055]

In version 4.0 and above, Confluence should be able to auto update page links when the linked page has been renamed. However this is not working when the title of the page contains any multi-byte characters such as Japanese or Chinese.

h4. Cause

This appears to be caused at the time the link is saved. If you save a link to a page called "First Page" in English, it looks like this in storage format:

{code:xml}<ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title="First Page" /></ac:link>{code}

However if you save a page called "最初のページ" in Japanese, then it looks like this:

{code:xml}<ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title="最初のページ" /><ac:plain-text-link-body><![CDATA[最初のページ]]></ac:plain-text-link-body></ac:link>{code}

The key difference is that there is an "ac:plain-text-link-body" section inserted, meaning that the link text has been overridden from the page name. The auto updater is only changing the "ri:page" element, specifically the "ri:content-title" attribute.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page called 最初のページ
# Create another page, and add a link to 最初のページ
# Rename the page 最初のページ to 二つ目のページ
# Reload the page with the link, and observe that the old page name remains

h4. Workaround

To get around the issue when creating a new page:

# Create the page named with Roman characters only
# Create a link to that page
# Rename the page to have multi-byte characters
# The link should be updated normally from then on, as long as the link isn't edited again

To make a link to an existing page:

# Rename the page to a title with Roman characters only
# Create a link to that page
# Rename it back to the old title
fields.summary: Page Link with Multi-byte character can't auto update

fields.description:
I've come across this issue a couple of times. In one instance, an OnDemand customer has imported a space but the importer didn't strip out the space layout and so he ended up with text at the top of each page in the space saying "#usernavbar()". I had to manually go to {{/spaces/resetdecorator.action?decoratorName=decorators/main.vmd&key=<space key>&atl_token=<token>}} to reset the decorator, as trying to view it at {{/spaces/listdecorators.action?key=<space key>}} just gave a message saying "You can not customise the site look and feel while a theme is active. You must first disable the currently configured theme."

The other one was an issue where the global layout had been changed in a previous version on Confluence, and upon updating to 4.1 the "Add Space" link on the Dashboard was missing. I had to manually reset the decorator by going to {{/admin/resetdecorator.action?decoratorName=decorators/global.vmd&alt_token=<token>}} to reset it.
fields.summary: Unable to view global or space layout when a theme is active

fields.description:
A customer raised a support issue where they had a 50-user license, had disabled 5 of those users and were trying to create more, but Confluence was insisting that there were still 50 users active and so he couldn't create more.

Even hitting "Refresh" did not work. The fix ended up being to flush the "Number Of Registered Users" cache on the Cache Statistics page.
fields.summary: Hitting Refresh doesn't update the "Number Of Registered Users" cache, results in incorrect user count
